references.paper_title: The relaxation method of finding the common point of convex sets and its application to the solution of problems in convex programming
references.reason: This paper introduces Bregman divergences, the core concept underlying the proposed method in the current paper.
This paper establishes the theoretical foundation of using Bregman divergences for clustering, providing context and justification for extending its application to image similarity.

references.paper_title: Towards deep learning models resistant to adversarial attacks
references.reason: This highly influential work on adversarial robustness provides the framework and motivation for the authors' approach to enhance robustness using adversarial training.

references.paper_title: Benchmarking neural network robustness to common corruptions and perturbations
references.reason: This paper introduces a widely used benchmark dataset (CIFAR-10-C) for evaluating robustness against image corruptions, which is directly used and analyzed in this research.

references.paper_title: The unreasonable effectiveness of deep features as a perceptual metric
references.reason: This paper introduces the LPIPS metric, a state-of-the-art perceptual similarity measure that serves as a primary comparative baseline for evaluating the proposed approach.
